DOC.brief_summary: Does baseline impedance measure landmark phase esophageal High resolution impedance manometry HRIM correlate direct mucosal impedance measurement discriminate GERD non GERD patient ?
DOC.brief_title: HRIM v Mucosal Impedance GERD Participants
DOC.detailed_description: Patients refer Mayo Clinic Rochester clinically indicate high resolution impedance manometry ( HRIM ) , 24 hour impedance pH ( MII-pH ) study , esophagogastroduodenoscopy ( EGD ) recruit . Gastroesophageal reflux define total 24 hour esophageal acid exposure time ≥5 % regardless concomitant Proton Pump inhibitor ( PPI ) use . A negative 24 hour MII-pH study define acid exposure time ≤2 % PPI therapy ≤1 % PPI therapy .
DOC.criteria: Patients see Mayo clinic Rochester clinically indicate endoscopy , high resolution impedance manometry 24 hour pH impedance study . Inclusion criterion : Adults age 1890 Patients schedule complete HRIM ( within 5 day ) Patients schedule recently complete MIIpH study ( within 5 day ) Patients schedule EGD Exclusion criterion : Technically limited esophageal HRIM MIIpH study Patients HRIM MIIpH study perform within 5 day Patients EGD perform within 30 day HRIM MIIpH study Medical condition severe heart lung disease preclude safe performance endoscopy Inability read due : Blindness , cognitive dysfunction , English language illiteracy
